reviews.title: hanging out in Hana
reviews.text: We just spent a week at the hotel, and had a lovely time. Our garden junior suite (I think everything is a suite except the ocean view cottages) was large and comfortable, and the pools, beach, spa, and other amenities were great. The food was very pricey, and we preferred food at the bar (where there was usually great music, too): shrimp, great fries, good salads, etc. There are only three places to eat dinner in Hana: the hotel restaurant, the hotel bar, and a restaurant also owned by the hotel. Although we didn't go for the food, it would nice to have more choices. We went to relax, and that made it a perfect choice. The Hana Highway is certainly slow, but not scary. It is, however, absolutely beautiful. The hotel is a great place for quiet: even when it was full we were often alone or with only a few other people. If you're really tired, this is a great idea--and rent a convertible.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything about this hotel is top notch. My husband and I stayed there for 2 nights and we wish we could have stayed longer. Definitely book a cottage with an ocean view and check out the early morning yoga. The entire place is just so peaceful and relaxing. I can't say enought good things about it.
reviews.title: The best of the best!

likes.liked: — The amazing view of the ocean from our cottage.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent three nights here after four nights in Wailea. What a difference! This area really seemed to be what I always thought Hawaii was like. The hotel was very nice, peaceful and elegant. We had booked a Bay Cottage. Be warned: there is a road that runs behind many of these cottages. We were in #41. While it's a teeny town, the cars do zoom by and they seemed very loud. We expressed our concern immediately to the hotel manager and she swiftly upgraded us to a Sea Cottage (#206). That was a very nice gesture. The lay-out is great and relaxed. The wellness pool is wonderful and it's great to look at the ocean from the hot tub. I went to the spa and was pleased. Our only gripe was the main restaurant. There were only a few selections and none were under $30 for an entree. They brag about how the fish is so local, so why in the world do I have to pay $32 for it? I live in Manhattan and routinely get fabulous meals for well under that. Furthermore, the portions were very small. We found the bar food to have better prices and portion sizes. Even a small Caesar salad (with added grilled fish) was pretty filling for a light dinner. We didn't participate in any of the activities at the hotel, but did take a three-hour horseback trip through Maui Stables. The guide was great, but it was my first time on a horse and I am never doing THAT again.
reviews.title: Very nice, but restaurant is disappointing
The Best Place we have ever stayed!!!!
reviews.text: I read the earlier postings about mosquitos, but we didn't have a problem. It was quite breezy, so maybe that's why.

reviews.title: Heaven in Hana
reviews.text: Final point: I filled out the review form pretty thoroughly before we left on March 27. Lo and behold, I received a letter yesterday from the head of food and beverages at the hotel. He expressed concern about my restaurant comments and explained that they purposely keep the selections limited. He didn't address the small portions, but still - that was a great gesture and seemed genuine.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hotel Hana Maui for one night only after having problems with another place we had booked. The one day that we spent there was the highlight of our 16 day stay in Maui. We only wished we had known about it sooner so we could have stayed longer!
reviews.title: Best Hotel Experience Ever
Unexpected Suprises
reviews.text: Everything was perfect. We decided to upgrade at the last minute to a Sea Ranch cottage. The front desk staff went out of their way to find us the nicest cottage available. The concierge personally greeted us with leis and cold, lemon-scented cloths. The porter gave us a tour of the property and explained a brief history of the hotel.

Our Sea Ranch cottage was decorated with Hawaiian art and had a beautiful tiled bath, a bar, and a separate area to sit. On the table was a loaf of homemade banana bread and a basket with tropical fruit and snacks. The mini-fridge had an assortment of beverages which were included in the price of the stay. A small welcome note personally addressed to us was next to the snacks.
reviews.title: Our best hotel in Hawaii

reviews.text: We were lucky enough to arrive on a Thursday and enjoyed the manager's reception with appetizers and drinks at the plantation house above the hotel. All of the staff at the reception were warm and welcoming and this felt like 'the aloha' that people speak about.
reviews.title: Possible to love or hate

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were also lucky enough to stay in the month of September when the hotel is adults only. This made our time at the pool even more relaxing. The pools are open all night (at least in September) and we enjoyed a wonderful night swim. The view from the pool near the Sea Ranch cottages is fantastic, especially at sunset.
reviews.title: A piece of heaven in Heavenly Hana!
A Promise Fulfilled

reviews.text: I took my mother, who had a really big birthday on Feb. 11th, and
reviews.title: Amazing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The road to Hana is a review all by itself, I think its too over rated. Waterfalls were dried up, locals rude drivers and others places in Hawaii are more beautiful and less dangerous. Having said that, we decided to stay one night in Hana to avoid driving back the same day. We choose Hotel Hana Maui, as there are not alot of choices in Hana and this propoery appeared to be the best....and it is.
reviews.title: We Should have Stayed Longer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon check in, Shannon greeted us like royality. Our room was ready and we arrived at noon. The porter gave us a complete tour of the property on our way to our room #507. Sea ranch with a whirlpool on the porch overlooking the ocean...how perfect is that? The cottage is so spacious and clean. Very Hawaiian decor, so dont expect the Four Seasons, but this resort completes the reason why we came to Hawaii. The hotel deliverd Macadamia nut bread(the best) ,fresh tropical fruit and wine. Pleasing touch.
reviews.title: No air conditioning

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went to the managers reception at the Plantation house and spent quit a bit of time talking to him. The staff at this resort was the best. We travel 4-5 times per year, so have a lot to compare to.
reviews.title: Too many bugs at Hotel Hana

likes.liked: — very romantic other than the bugs in the room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had dinner at Kauiki, the food was just ok. Very expensive. Slow service, but we had nowhere to go. That is really the only problem with this property, not alot of food choices.
reviews.title: A perfect place for a special Occassion and more...

reviews.text: The art gallery on property is great, we enjoyed browsing and bought a painting. The pool is refresing and has a great location.
